title: IAC Funding
description: Yearly funding information and grants for the Immunization Action Coalition (IAC): IAC receives funding from a variety of sources, including the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).
cleaned_text: Coalition drives its mission by operating programs supported with educational grants and other donations as well as by conducting partnership projects targeted at specific goals that promote immunization and increase rates. | | | |Funding from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) is provided for specific projects. | | | |The following is a list of current supporters and partners that share IACs commitment to public health. | | | | | | | | | | Centers for Disease Control and Prevention | | | |National Center for Immunization and Respiratory Diseases, CDC | | | | | | | | | | | |E. Payne Estate Mark and Muriel Wexler Foundation Anonymous | | | | | | | | | | |AstraZeneca | GlaxoSmithKline Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson Merck Sharp & Dohme Corp. Moderna Pfizer Inc. Sanofi Pasteur Seqirus | | | | | | | | | | |American Pharmacists Association | | | | | | | | | | | |In memory of Daniel Bower Banks IV and Gail Joanne Banks | | | |In memory of William Darnall | | | |In memory of Becky Payne | | | | | | | | | |Individuals, Organizations, and Others | | | |Health plans | Hospitals Immunization coalitions Pharmacies Physicians' Alliance of America Private practices Subscribers Supporters of immunization United Way donors Website visitors | | | | |IAC's IRS Form 990s are available from |[GuideStar](http://www2.guidestar.org/organizations/41-1768237/immunization-action-coalition.aspx), a repository of financial information about nonprofits. | | | | | | |This page was updated on August 30, 2021. | | | |This page was reviewed on December 23, 2020. |
